title: Prohibited AI practices
structure: Eight prohibited practices (a-h) with (h) having narrow exceptions + detailed procedural regime

5_1_a_manipulation.title: Subliminal and manipulative techniques

elements.element: AI system that deploys subliminal techniques beyond person's consciousness OR purposefully manipulative or deceptive techniques
With objective OR effect of materially distorting behaviour
By appreciably impairing ability to make informed decision
Thereby causing decision person would not have otherwise taken
In manner that causes or is reasonably likely to cause significant harm
elements.note: To that person, another person, or group of persons

examples_hypothetical: AI-powered dark patterns with subliminal cues

5_1_b_vulnerability_exploitation.title: Exploitation of vulnerabilities

elements.element: AI system that exploits vulnerabilities
Of natural person or specific group
Due to age, disability, or specific social or economic situation
With objective OR effect of materially distorting behaviour
In manner that causes or is reasonably likely to cause significant harm

5_1_b_vulnerability_exploitation.protected_groups: Vulnerable persons - children, elderly, disabled, economically/socially disadvantaged
examples_hypothetical: Predatory lending AI targeting vulnerable groups

5_1_c_social_scoring.title: Social scoring (INFERRED FROM CONTEXT)
5_1_c_social_scoring.source_note: Full text missing from source MD - reconstructed from Recital 31 and sub-points (i)(ii)
5_1_c_social_scoring.inferred_prohibition: AI systems for social scoring leading to detrimental treatment

conditions.text: Detrimental or unfavourable treatment of certain natural persons or groups of persons in social contexts that are unrelated to the contexts in which the data was originally generated or collected
conditions.note: Context mismatch - using data out of original context

conditions.text: Detrimental or unfavourable treatment of certain natural persons or groups of persons that is unjustified or disproportionate to their social behaviour or its gravity

5_1_c_social_scoring.recital_31_guidance: Evaluating/classifying persons based on social behaviour data over time, leading to detrimental treatment in unrelated contexts or disproportionate to behaviour

5_1_d_criminal_risk_assessment.title: Criminal risk assessment based solely on profiling

activities: putting into service for this specific purpose

elements.element: Making risk assessments of natural persons
To assess or predict risk of committing criminal offence
Based SOLELY on profiling OR assessing personality traits and characteristics
elements.critical: SOLELY is key - if combined with other factors, not prohibited

exception.text: Prohibition shall NOT apply to AI systems used to SUPPORT human assessment of involvement in criminal activity, which is already based on objective and verifiable facts directly linked to criminal activity
conditions_for_exception: Assessment already based on objective and verifiable facts
Facts directly linked to criminal activity
exception.note: Exception allows risk assessment tools if human remains decision-maker and objective evidence exists

5_1_d_criminal_risk_assessment.critical_distinction: Purely predictive profiling (prohibited) vs. evidence-based human-assisted assessment (permitted)
5_1_d_criminal_risk_assessment.examples: Minority Report style pure prediction = prohibited; Evidence-based risk tools supporting investigators = permitted

5_1_e_facial_recognition_scraping.title: Untargeted facial recognition database creation

activities: putting into service for this specific purpose

elements.element: AI systems that create or expand facial recognition databases
Through untargeted scraping
Of facial images from internet or CCTV footage

5_1_e_facial_recognition_scraping.critical_element: Untargeted scraping - mass collection without consent
5_1_e_facial_recognition_scraping.permitted: Targeted, consensual database creation for specific purposes

5_1_f_emotion_recognition_workplace_educ.title: Emotion inference in workplace and education

activities: putting into service for this specific purpose

elements.element: AI systems to infer emotions of natural person
In areas of workplace and education institutions

exception.text: EXCEPT where use intended to be put in place or into market for medical or safety reasons

5_1_f_emotion_recognition_workplace_educ.policy_rationale: Protect worker and student rights against emotional surveillance
5_1_f_emotion_recognition_workplace_educ.critical_distinction: Emotion recognition vs. physical state detection (fatigue) per Recital 18

5_1_g_biometric_categorisation_sensitive.title: Biometric categorisation for sensitive attributes

activities: putting into service for this specific purpose

elements.element: Biometric categorisation systems
That categorise natural persons based on biometric data
To deduce or infer sensitive attributes

exception.text: Prohibition does NOT cover labelling/filtering of lawfully acquired biometric datasets OR categorizing biometric data in law enforcement
exception.examples: Sorting police database images by hair/eye color for investigation

5_1_g_biometric_categorisation_sensitive.policy_rationale: Prevent discriminatory profiling based on protected characteristics

5_1_h_realtime_biometric_identification.title: Real-time remote biometric identification in publicly accessible spaces for law enforcement
5_1_h_realtime_biometric_identification.source_note: Full text missing from source MD - reconstructed from sub-points (i)(ii)(iii) and extensive procedural regime in 5(2)-(7)
5_1_h_realtime_biometric_identification.confidence_overall: MEDIUM-HIGH - source incomplete but clear from context
5_1_h_realtime_biometric_identification.general_prohibition: Use of real-time remote biometric identification systems in publicly accessible spaces for law enforcement purposes

narrow_exceptions.description: Prohibited EXCEPT for exhaustively listed law enforcement objectives

objectives.text: The targeted search for specific victims of abduction, trafficking in human beings or sexual exploitation of human beings, as well as the search for missing persons
The prevention of a specific, substantial and imminent threat to the life or physical safety of natural persons or a genuine and present or genuine and foreseeable threat of a terrorist attack

The localisation or identification of a person suspected of having committed a criminal offence, for the purpose of conducting a criminal investigation or prosecution or executing a criminal penalty for offences referred to in Annex II and punishable in the Member State concerned by a custodial sentence or a detention order for a maximum period of at least four years
requirements: Punishable by ≥4 years custody in Member State
objectives.note: Serious crime suspects only - threshold ensures proportionality

procedural_safeguards.description: Even when exception applies, strict procedural requirements per Art 5(2)-(7)

requirements.authority: Judicial authority OR independent administrative authority with binding decision
requirements.timing: Before use (except duly justified urgency - then within 24h)

elements: Seriousness, probability, scale of harm if not used

requirements.note: Only to confirm specifically targeted individual's identity
Member State must explicitly authorize in national law
No adverse legal effect based solely on system output

5_1_h_realtime_biometric_identification.confidence_overall: HIGH on procedural regime, MEDIUM on base prohibition text
5_1_h_realtime_biometric_identification.policy_balance: General prohibition with narrow, heavily proceduralized exceptions for serious law enforcement needs
5_1_h_realtime_biometric_identification.critical_note: Most restrictive prohibition in entire Act - reflects fundamental rights concerns (Recitals 32-38)

article_5_8.text: This Article shall not affect the prohibitions that apply where an AI practice infringes other Union law
article_5_8.interpretation: Article 5 is cumulative with other prohibitions - not exclusive

synthesis.most_complex: 5(1)(h) - real-time biometric ID with extensive procedural regime
synthesis.interpretative_intensity: HIGH - many fuzzy concepts requiring LLM evaluation

metadata.status: complete with source verification needed for 5(1)(c) and 5(1)(h) full text
metadata.source_issues: MD source missing full text of 5(1)(c) and 5(1)(h) - reconstructed from context
